title: Job 3:1
text: AFTER this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

title: Job 3:2
text: And Job spake, and said,

title: Job 3:3
text: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.

title: Job 3:4
text: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.

title: Job 3:5
text: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

title: Job 3:6
text: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.

title: Job 3:7
text: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.

title: Job 3:8
text: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.

title: Job 3:9
text: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:

title: Job 3:10
text: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother's womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.

title: Job 3:11
text: Why died I not from the womb?  why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?

title: Job 3:12
text: Why did the knees prevent me?  or why the breasts that I should suck?

title: Job 3:13
text: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

title: Job 3:14
text: With kings and counsellers of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;

title: Job 3:15
text: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

title: Job 3:16
text: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.

title: Job 3:17
text: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.

title: Job 3:18
text: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.

title: Job 3:19
text: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.

title: Job 3:20
text: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;

title: Job 3:21
text: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;

title: Job 3:22
text: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?

title: Job 3:23
text: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?

title: Job 3:24
text: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.

title: Job 3:25
text: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.

title: Job 3:26
text: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
